c_Si_modules: crystalline silicon (c-Si), NOCT 45ºC and temperature coefficient of the Pmax -0.45 %/K
annual_temp_xls: Average of Daily (24 hours) air temperature at 2m
pv_system_def: Installed power: 1 kWp, Modules: CSI modules, NOCT = 45 ºC, temperature coeff. of the Pmax = _0.45 %/K, Inverters: Central inverters with Euro efficiency 97.5%, Mounting of PV modules: Fixed mounting structures South oriented with optimum tilt angle and with typical row spacing. Other DC losses: Dirt, dust, soiling, frost, snow, DC cabling losses, electrical mismatch, electrical losses of 5.5%. Transformer: Standard high efficiency transformer, electrical losses of 1.5%
monthly_ghi: Monthly/yearly sum of global horizontal irradiation
monthly_dni: Monthly/yearly sum of direct normal irradiation
monthly_gti: Monthly/yearly sum of global tilted irradiation
monthly_temp_xls: Monthly / yearly average of daily (24 hours) air temperature at 2m
monthly_pvout: Monthly sum of photovoltaic electricity production
monthly_pvout_xls: Monthly / yearly expected specific PV electricity

ts_title.ghi: Global horizontal irradiation: Monthly and yearly sums
ts_title.dni: Direct normal irradiation: Monthly and yearly sums
ts_title.gti: Global tilted irradiation: Monthly and yearly sums
ts_title.temp: Average daily (24 hour) air temperature at 2 m

measured_ghi: Monthly sum of global horizontal irradiation
measured_dni: Monthly sum of direct normal irradiation
measured_plot_meteo: Measured air temperature and wind speed
lta_meaning: LTA - Long-term average. Interannual variability is given by one standard deviation (STDEV) of mean (white: normal years, red or blue: extreme years), yearly STDEV is
data_description_content1: The solar resource and meteorological data are pre_calculated from 15_minute and 30_minute primary solar resource and meteorological time series using Solargis model version 2.0. The data represent a period from 01/01/1994 to 31/12/2014 (21 complete years). Expected photovoltaic power production data is calculated using Solargis solar and meteorological data for the following configuration:
modules: Modules: crystalline_silicon modules, NOCT = 45 ºC, temperature coeff. of the Pmax = _0.45 %/K
inverters: Inverters: Central inverters with Euro efficiency 97.5%
mounting: Mounting of PV modules: Fixed mounting structures facing to South with optimum inclination angle. Relative row spacing 2.5 (ratio of absolute spacing and rack width)
dc_losses: Other DC losses: Dirt, dust, soiling, frost, snow, DC cabling losses, electrical mismatch, electrical losses of 5.5%
transformer: Transformer: Standard high efficiency transformer, electrical losses of 1.5%
data_description_content2: Ground measured data comes from meteorological stations operated by MASEN. More information about the data can be found at https://solaratlas.masen.ma/about
data_uncertainty_content: In Morocco, the uncertainty of the yearly outputs of the original Solargis model is as follows: Global Horizontal Irradiation ±4.0%, Direct Normal Irradiation ±9.0%, Global Tilted Irradiation ±5.0%. Uncertainty of yearly air temperature for the majority of analysed ground stations is estimated at ±1.0ºC. However the uncertainty of air temperature can reach values as high as _4.0ºC in a complex terrain, such as the foothills of High Atlas Mountains. Uncertainty of yearly expected photovoltaic power production data is approx. ±6.5%. More information about the data uncertainty can be found at https://solaratlas.masen.ma/about#solargis_data.
mode_of_use_content: Solar resource, air temperature, photovoltaic power production (PVOUT) data and maps available in the Atlas serve as an indicator, which helps to understand solar power potential in Morocco, thus it is a useful tool for site selection and preliminary evaluation. PVOUT represents solar power estimate in the start-up phase of a PV system. The estimates are accurate enough for small and medium-size PV systems with pannels oriented to the south at optimum angle which is indicated in the GTI configuration. For planning and financing of large projects, more information is needed: 1. Detailed specification of a PV system, 2. PV simulation based on multiyear historical time series or at least TMY data, 3. Interannual variability and P90 uncertainty of the PV production, 4. Lifetime energy production considering performance degradation of PV components. More information about full PV yield assessment can be found at https://solaratlas.masen.ma/about#how-to-use.
disclaimer_legal_content: Considering the uncertainty of data and calculations, Solargis does not guarantee the accuracy of estimates. The maximum possible has been done for the assessment of weather parameters based on the best available data, software and knowledge. Solargis nor MASEN shall not be liable for any direct, incidental, consequential, indirect or punitive damages arising or alleged to have arisen out of use of the provided report.
